content.description: On the left side of the boulder (right of Meat Snack, left of Jack Links) look for the middle, less featured section. Look low and identify and undercling slash for the sit start. Use the undercling for your right hand and pinch the same feature with your left. Toss out to a crimp ripple and then dyno high and right to the awesome, thin pancake plate/horn. Work up through ridiculous jugs to link into the finish up and left with "Meat Snack".
content.location: On the left side of the boulder (right of Meat Snack, left of Jack Links) look for the middle, less featured section.

content.description:
On the furthest left side of the boulder find where the vertical face slants down to a low roof and find the big jug in the steepness below the short overhang.

 Toss up to the lip and work left a bit across the featured vertical face. Climb up past wonderfully sculpted jug features back toward the left and top out to the top left through a vertical runnel to find the hidden jug in the back.
content.location: On the furthest left side of the boulder find where the vertical face slants down to a low roof and find the big jug in the steepness below

content.description:
In the middle of the boulder find the steep blunt arete/corner of the overhung middle. Look very low for the "scooped" section to match for the sit start.

 Work up and out of the steepness across positive holds to gain the enormous jugs above. Continue up and out over the lip to top out over the high bulge.
content.location: In the middle of the boulder find the steep blunt arete/corner of the overhung middle. Look very low for the "scooped" section

content.description: A uniquely, highly featured steeply overhung boulder. This wonderfully complex boulder is covered with holds varying from massive jugs to practically unusable edges. Bands and swirls of sculpted sandstone ripples and iron plates. Good landings!
